title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Hofstra University
Interview Descriptions: Online application and heard back about 2 weeks later. Virtual (zoom) interview and in-person panel interview over the course of one month. Process was easy to navigate but took a long time.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you faced a challenge at work.

title: Resident Safety Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Hofstra University (Hempstead, NY)
Interview Descriptions: It was fairly straightforward. We talked for a half hour. I was interviewed by the director of safety services and then began training with other employees. Overall good experience of looking for a job on campus.
Interview Questions: what past experiences do you have?

title: Assistant Dean Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Hofstra University
Interview Descriptions: One initial phone screening to see if you would be a good fit for the role, one zoom call and one presentation on a topic of your choosing. Then an offer possibly
Interview Questions: How do you work with people who’s priorities don’t line up with your own

title: Financial Aid Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Hofstra University in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Received an email a few days after applying for an initial phone interview. The interview process involves 3 parts which include a zoom meeting for the follow up interview and a 5 minute presentation for the final interview.
Interview Questions: What attracted you to apply for this role? What skills and experience do you have that are related to this role?

title: Career Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Hofstra University in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was an initial telephone interview, a 1st round zoom panel interview and finally a third round on campus day with interview, tour and presentation.   The final round was a 5 hour event.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself?

How would you find information on a background you didn’t know.

title: Social Media Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Hofstra University
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward and pleasant, especially for being focused on the catering company. The head of social media was really awesome and kid, and you can tell she is passionate about her own position.
Interview Questions: What is a program I would create?

title: Admission Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Hofstra University (Hempstead, NY) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: First is a Phone interview, then there will be a small zoom interview, followed by a group presentation with multiple members of the admission staff (you create your own presentation)
Interview Questions: Describe why you would like to be a member of Hofstra

title: Resident Safety Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Hofstra University (Hempstead, NY) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very easy interview process. Got a couple of questions wrong, but was still offered the job. Have to answer questions about made up scenarios that may happen on the job
Interview Questions: What would you do if someone is trying to enter the residence hall with someone who appears drunk?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Hofstra University (Hofstra Univ, NY) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: It's very relaxed and the head of the Program interviews you with questions having to do with personal values, reasons for joining the program, and self-motivational topics that help the individual. Interview process was good.
Interview Questions: tell me about urself ?

title: Teachers Aide Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Hofstra University
Interview Descriptions: I talked to the director and had a wonderful time talking about their options and what I would be doing. Talked whether I was comfortable with working with kids and my experience with children.
Interview Questions: Where have you previously worked?

title: M A Industrial/Organizational Psychology Program Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Hofstra University (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty straight forward. They asked me what I knew about I/O, and then proceeded to ask what I wanted to do after I graduated. They also asked about any relevant research experience.
Interview Questions: What do you know about I/O?

title: Program Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Hofstra University (New York, NY) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview had 3 interviewers and it lasted about 45 minutes. They all were really nice and we kicked it off immediately. We had conversations like we had known each other for years.
Interview Questions: Why do I want this job?

title: Attorney Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Hofstra University
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with entire legal department and the HR director. It is a good group, but after my interviews were over I had a discussion with them about compensation and it was very much below my range, so I declined to move forward.
Interview Questions: Do you mind doing “grunt” work?

title: Resident Safety Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Hofstra University (Hofstra Univ, NY) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back interview. If you read the manual and understand the core concepts then you should get the job no problem. The interview doesn't ask any "gotcha" questions and is very straightforward such as "what would you do in this situation" type questions. All the answers are present within the manual
Interview Questions: If you see a fight going on what do you?

title: Writing Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Hofstra University
Interview Descriptions: Applied by reaching out to the Director in charge of the center. I was scheduled for an interview a few days after. The hiring process was pretty much seamless and final decision was communicated in a
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with tutoring?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Hofstra University in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Easy going but had to interview with a committee. There were a number or people- at least 6 people in the room asking questions. They were nice but because the number of people - it was at first intimating.
Interview Questions: Q: Were about my experience in field

title: Lab Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Hofstra University
Interview Descriptions: I got a phone interview after a couple of weeks. Normal questions related to the work, not difficult. Unfortunately, my background doesn't match. They seems looking for somebody could start working immediately, no training offered.
Interview Questions: research experience

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Hofstra University in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview and test with HR, interview with supervisor, review of resume, review of references, overview of position, hours, organizational structure, expectations, workplace, university geography, code of conduct, Hunan resources manual and handbook
Interview Questions: Job history as indicated on resume. Education review. Review of position, hours, expectations, workplace.  Review of benefits, tuition reimbursement, salary

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Hofstra University (Uniondale, NY) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was called in for an interview approximately a week and a half after submitting my resume. The interview was scheduled for 2 hours. Great and welcoming staff. I was then called to schedule a test to test my proficiency in Microsoft Office (with the exception of PowerPoint). It was a 3 part test that was timed, but 30 minutes was allotted for each segment. Received an offer the following day.
Interview Questions: They ask about a challenges and adversity that I have faced and my solution.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Hofstra University in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: first you need to send an e-mail or whatever to find available Graduate assistance opportunities. Then you need to send your resume and self introduction. During the interview need to prove your office abilities
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self

title: Resident Safety Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Hofstra University (Hempstead, NY) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. Got an email the next day to come in for an interview. They email you a packet and a powerpoint to read over before the interview. The questions were based off the packet and powerpoint they sent you. Very easy interview.
Interview Questions: What do you do if someone is being uncooperative?

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Hofstra University (Hempstead, NY) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: they were very responsive, made me feel comfortable, the staff was welcoming, currently they have flexible work hours especially for student members to help them cope with their curriculum. I am really happy at my work place.
Interview Questions: strengths and weakness , experince

title: Assistant Director Of Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Hofstra University (Hempstead, NY) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Standard meeting with office directors, went over resume, relevant experience, built report, established firm understanding of role and expectations. Went over timeline for on-boarding and general information regarding the department.
Interview Questions: What drew you to this role?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Hofstra University (Hempstead, NY) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: I sent in my resume as I was instructed to do under the position tab on the Student Job Board. Then I was contacted shortly after via email and phone and had an interview set up within a week.
Interview Questions: What relevant customer service experience do you have?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Hofstra University (New York, NY) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Quick and to the point. I went in and was called in immediately to talk to two of the deans. They had my resume in hand and took their questions directly from there asking me about past work experiences and skills.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working at this office?

title: Social Media Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Hofstra University (Hempstead, NY) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is pretty relaxed but very professional. The manager will ask our experiences on social media and why do we want to be a social media assistant.
Interview Questions: Do you have any recommendations after viewing our current social media sites?

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Hofstra University (Hempstead, NY) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I needed to have complete Calculus II with an A and was assigned various math problems for different courses to improve my knowledge to teach. The supervisor himself will be talking to you and assigning problems to you during Summer and Winter break so you can be prepare to teach all the necessary courses during Fall and Spring semester.
Interview Questions: What is the approach that you use to teach someone when he or she doesn't understand a problem?

title: Facilities Service Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Hofstra University
Interview Descriptions: very easy, asked about availability, my work ethic, how long I have been at the university. Very easy interview and ended up working for the facilities department for 3 years. Excellent job!
Interview Questions: Are you available weekends

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Hofstra University (Hempstead, NY) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very brief and casual. The told me they needed people on the front desk and asked what my hours and or schedule looked like. They asked if I had experience with clerical work and I did. Then I was hired on the spot.
Interview Questions: What's your availability

title: Resident Safety Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Hofstra University
Interview Descriptions: Mostly situational questions, really make you feel uncomfortable when they tell you that you're wrong. The interview occurs in their small office with other employees in the room. Unless you answer every question wrong, you'll probably be hired.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a student tries to swipe in with a clearly intoxicated student?

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Hofstra University (Hempstead, NY) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I felt that was not a very comprehensive interview.  I felt the interviewer could have spent a little more time on the interview.  I felt as if she was rushing the entire process or she already had someone for the job
Interview Questions: Why are you changing jobs?

title: Student Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Hofstra University (Hempstead, NY) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Easy, simple questions. Just be relaxed and answer the questions. The questions aren't tricky they just want to see if you are a positive person and if you are willing to speak on the phone. If you have prior experience then that is great but not necessary.
Interview Questions: Have you ever convinced anyone to do something?

title: RSSC Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Hofstra University
Interview Descriptions: Basically like a test. All scenarios. They offer you a position based on how you score compared to other applicants. Likes when you ask questions and take notes. Study RSR handbook and know procedures like the back of your hand.
Interview Questions: What to do when you see an RSR asleep in booth?

title: Media Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Hofstra University
Interview Descriptions: It was very slow. Takes a while for them to call you back. Not enough transparency of responsibilities. Had the initial then got called back for a second. People who interviewed me were friendly but didn't seem to happy about working there.
Interview Questions: Would you work weekends?

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Hofstra University (Hempstead, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I was brought directly to the campus without a phone interview.  I first met with the departmental selection committee who asked questions.  The tone of the interview was very friendly and was a more "meet and greet" style with a few question directed toward my specific roles and responsibilities. I then taught a sample class while being observed.  Once the class was finished I was taken out for a very nice dinner.
Interview Questions: The future use and role of technology in my field and how that would be implemented into my future teaching.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Hofstra University (Hempstead, NY) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Management had found me through their career website. The interview was very informal, and very casual. I was interviewed by two managers but because of the nature of their work, they knew how to put a candidate at ease. They e-mailed me for an interview, I took the interview, and I had the job, easy as that.
Interview Questions: 'We only glanced at your resume, tell us about your prior experience and how it relates to this position specifically?'

title: RSR Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Hofstra University (Hempstead, NY) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The job interview process can be lengthy. Being interviewed once and getting a job offer is typically a thing of the past. Today, many companies have an involved interview process starting with screening interviews, followed by in-person interviews, second interviews and even third interviews
Interview Questions: why do you think you can be good at this job

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Hofstra University (New York, NY) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: it went very easy and they are very simple. they just wanted to make sure that you knew that you were dealing with people and students all day and you could handle being on the phone.
Interview Questions: how many hours can you work per week

title: Clerical Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Hofstra University (Uniondale, NY) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Took computerized test for word office suite.  Met with human resources than met with department position was in.  Easy to find.  Friendly office staff.  Very hard to get a staff position due to union.
Interview Questions: Basic questions.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Hofstra University
Interview Descriptions: Resume-first round-second round-final round. It was pretty fast only took 2 weeks to know the result. Supervisors are all educated MBA or Dr. they are very nice. It is very competitive tho I think over 200 people applied but only 2 got accepted.
Interview Questions: How will you balance your job and your study

title: Help Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Hofstra University (Hempstead, NY) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an email telling me to come into the office. The interview lasted about 30 min and I was asked when my availability was to begin the job. After that I went through training.
Interview Questions: I was asked the basic questions. Tell me about yourself etc.

title: Rec Center Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Hofstra University
Interview Descriptions: took only 5 days to get the offer..2 interviews face to face and group interview..the interviewer was nice and only had to answer around 5 questions..make sure you ask them questions back and be positive and confident
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Resident Safety Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Hofstra University in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Called them right after I sent in my application. They told me to come in for an interview. As soon as you get the interview you can pretty much rest assure that you will get the job.
Interview Questions: Do you follow rules?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Hofstra University (Hofstra Univ, NY) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: You fill out the application, get a couple references, and then you get invited to the group session. If you do well in the group session, you get invited to a "creative session" where you have to sing, dance, create a presentation, tell them why you deserve to be an RA. If you do well in that then you get an individual interview with an RD and a current RA.
Interview Questions: Who do you admire?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Hofstra University (Hempstead, NY) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: You may send an email to a professor and the professor will contact you. The interview is about what you can do for the professor.
Interview Questions: What kind of computer skills you are familiar?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Hofstra University (Hofstra Univ, NY) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: talk with professor
Interview Questions: personal background financial skill
